Race.SpecificTitle: Huntington Pk. Subd.Imp.Dist. -- Annual Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Special annual fee in the amount not to exceed two hundred fifty ($250.00) dollars for a period not to exceed (8) years on all taxable real property in the Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District for promoting and encouraging security of the Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual fee (except that no fee shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District Tax, on taxable real property situated within the boundaries of the Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District (which District is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues:  the area located between Morrison Road on the north, Crowder Boulevard on the west, Huntington Park Drive on the south and both sides of Benson Court located next to the Benson Canal on the east, thus comprising all of the Huntington Park Subdivision, said District shall not include property zoned and used as commercial property; and, as specified by Resolution R 10-96 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed two hundred fifty dollars ($250) annually for a period not to exceed eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, with an estimated $23,450 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Huntington Park Subdivision Improvement District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Carmel Subd. Imp. Dist. -- Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a parcel fee in the amount not to exceed two hundred fifty ($250) on all taxable real property in the Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District for a period not to exceed five (5) years to promote and encourage security and the overall betterment of the Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a parcel fee (except that no fee shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District Tax, on taxable real property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District (which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter and avenues: as bounded by the northeast intersection of the Jahncke Canal right-of-way of the 1-10 Service Road; thence north 36 degrees, 27 minutes, 35 seconds west for distance of 301.68 feet to a point; thence north 58 degrees, 51 minutes, 53 seconds east for a distance of 80.35 feet to a point of beginning; thence north 58 degrees, 51 minutes, 53 seconds east for a distance of 948.74 feet to a point of curvature; thence along an arc curving to the left and having a radius of 1430 feet for a distance of 498.82 feet to a point of tangency; thence north 33 degrees, 5 minutes, 25 seconds east for a distance of 76.61 feet to a point at the west right-of-way line of West Renaissance Court, 1-10 Service Road, the Gannon Canal, and the real property lines of lots fronting on North Lake Carmel Drive and Chatelain Court, plus a property abutting west of the Lake Carmel Subdivision, as specified by Resolution R-10-124 of the City Council of New Orleans in the amount not to exceed two hundred fifty dollars ($250) annually for a period not to exceed five (5) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2015, with an estimated $83,750 expected to be collected from the levy of the special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security and the overall betterment of the Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Carmel Subdivision Improvement District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Forest Estates Imp. Dist. -- Annual Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lake Forest Estates Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A special annual fee in the amount not to exceed four hundred eighty-five dollars ($485) on all taxable real property for eight (8) years in the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District to promote and encourage security in the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual tax (except that no tax shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana, subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District Tax, on taxable real property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District (which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter streets and avenues: Lake Forest Estates 1 and Lake Forest Estates 2 subdivisions), as specified by Resolution R-10-97 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed four hundred eighty-five dollars ($485) on all parcels of land located within Lake Forest Estates Improvement District for eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, with an estimated $66,220 expected to be collected from the levy of a special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security and the overall betterment in the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Forest Estates Improvement District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided by the New Orleans Police Department?
